pageContext.description: Spirally twisted links. Composed of 3 separate strands, formed of quadruple links, held together by the bolt ends of the necklace. The fastening is arranged by means of a bolt having a double pin made to slide in and out of a loop. The outside of the lock is ornamented with granulations.
pageContext.collection: National Museum of Science and Art, Dublin,Frontispiece 475, 232, 1903
pageContext.site: Ireland,Co. Londonderry,near Limavady,in the barony of Keenaght,townland of Broighter,found in a field (1896) on the farm of Mr. Joseph L. Gibson - by ploughmen.
pageContext.toSearch: Broighter Rd, Limavady, Limavady Bt49 9du, UK
pageContext.museumCollection: National Museum of Science & Art, Dublin
